definition: Gejiu, county level city in Yunnan, capital of Honghe Hani and Yi autonomous county 紅河哈尼族彞族自治州|红河哈尼族彝族自治州[Hong2 he2 Ha1 ni2 zu2 Yi2 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 zhou1]

sentences.english: Are new products and services being offered that were not a part of the old site?
sentences.chinese: 還是提供的新產品和服務不屬於舊的網站的一部分？

sentences.english: Don't do this on an old, slow machine.
sentences.chinese: 不要在速度慢的舊機器上這麼做。

sentences.english: Remove the old faucet and scrape any old putty or caulk from the basin.
sentences.chinese: 拆調舊水龍頭，並颳去洗槽舊的膩子或填充物。

sentences.english: Remove the old faucet and scrape any old putty or caulk from the basin.
sentences.chinese: 拆調舊水龍頭，並颳去洗槽舊的膩子或填充物。

sentences.english: The centralization and the decentralization in the old China competed and alternate mutually.
sentences.chinese: 舊中國中央集權與地方分權相互競爭，相互交替。

sentences.english: We are the country with five-thousand-year culture, old buildings are one of the evidences.
sentences.chinese: 我們是用五千年文化的國家，舊建築物的依據之一。

sentences.english: Remember the terrible accident that opened each episode of the old television show?
sentences.chinese: 想起舊電視節目上展開每段情節的可怕事件了嗎？

sentences.english: The devastated old China is gone for ever.
sentences.chinese: 瘡痍滿目的舊中國一去不復返了。

sentences.english: She leafed through some old magazines while waiting for her husband.
sentences.chinese: 在等她的丈夫時，她翻閱了一些舊雜誌。

sentences.english: She came across a pile of old photographs while she was clearing the attic.
sentences.chinese: 她打掃閣樓時偶然發現了一沓舊照片。

sentences.english: New Presbyter is but old Priest with large.
sentences.chinese: 新長老只不過是更廣泛意義上的舊牧師。

sentences.english: He persists in wearing that old-fashioned hat.
sentences.chinese: 他堅持要戴那頂舊帽子。

sentences.english: Cleaned out the garage and sold 2 old dehumidifiers on eBay.
sentences.chinese: 收拾了車庫，在易趣上賣掉了兩臺舊除溼機。

sentences.english: He discarded an old hat and an old pair of shoes.
sentences.chinese: 他扔掉了一頂舊帽子和一雙舊鞋。

sentences.english: An old friend of mine just called.
Five a side football game with top view.
sentences.chinese: 舊風格的頂視圖和快速的玩足球遊戲。

definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
